009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
018
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022
023
024/**
025 *
026 */
027public class CircleFitPratt extends CircleFitAlgebraic {
028        
029        private static final RealMatrix Bi =    // inverse of constraint matrix B
030                        MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] { 
031                                {  0,   0, 0, -0.5 },
032                                {  0,   1, 0,  0 },
033                                {  0,   0, 1,  0 },
034                                { -0.5, 0, 0,  0 }});
035        
036        private final double[] q;       // p = (A,B,C,D) circle parameters
037        
038        public CircleFitPratt(Pnt2d[] points) {
039                this.q = fit(points);
040        }
041        
042//      @Override
043//      public GeometricCircle getGeometricCircle() {
044//              if (isZero(p[0])) {                     // (abs(2 * A / s) < (1 / Rmax))
045//                      return null;                    // return a straight line
046//              }
047//              else {
048//                      return GeometricCircle.from(new AlgebraicCircle(p));
049//              }
050//      }
051
052        // enforce constraint B^2 + C^2 - 4 A D = 1 :
053        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
054        private double[] normalizeP(double[] q) {
055                final double A = q[0];
056                final double B = q[1];
057                final double C = q[2];
058                final double D = q[3];
059                double s  = Math.sqrt(sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D);
060                return new double[] {A/s, B/s, C/s, D/s};
061        }
062        
063
064        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts) {     // Version in Chernov (Table 5.1) - this version also works for the HyperFitter!
065//              IJ.log(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + " -- Version B");
066                final int nPoints = pts.length;
067                if (nPoints < 3) {
068                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
069                }
070                
071//              IJ.log("n = " + nPoints);
072                Pnt2d ctr = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
073                final double xr = ctr.getX();
074                final double yr = ctr.getY();
075
076                double[][] Xa = new double[Math.max(nPoints, 4)][4];    // Xa must have at least 4 rows!
077                for (int i = 0; i < pts.length; i++) {
078                        double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
079                        double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
080                        Xa[i][0] = sqr(x) + sqr(y);
081                        Xa[i][1] = x;
082                        Xa[i][2] = y;
083                        Xa[i][3] = 1;
084                }
085                // if nPoints = 3 (special case) the last row of the
086                // 4x4 matrix contains all zeros to make X singular!
087
088                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Xa);
089//              IJ.log("X = \n" + Matrix.toString(X.getData()));
090
091                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(X);
092                RealMatrix S = svd.getS();      
093                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
094                double[] svals = svd.getSingularValues();       // note: singular values are all positive (or zero)
095                
096                int minIdx = Matrix.idxMin(svals);
097                double smin = svals[minIdx];
098                int maxIdx = Matrix.idxMax(svals);
099                double smax = svals[maxIdx];
100                
101                RealVector qq = null;           // = \dot{q} solution vector (algebraic circle parameters)
102
103                double icond = smin / smax;
104//              IJ.log("Pratt fitter: icond = " + icond);
105                
106                if (icond < 1e-12) {                    // smin/smax = inverse condition number of X, 1e-12
107                        // singular case (X is rank deficient)
108                        qq = V.getColumnVector(minIdx);
109                } else {
110                        // regular (non-singular) case
111                
112                        // Version1 ---------------------------------------------------
113//                      RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S).multiply(V.transpose());
114//                      RealMatrix Z = Y.multiply(Bi).multiply(Y); // = Y * Bi * Y
115                        // Version2 ---------------------------------------------------
116                        RealMatrix Y = V.multiply(S);
117                        RealMatrix Z = Y.transpose().multiply(Bi).multiply(Y); // = Y^T * Bi * Y
118                        // ------------------------------------------------------------
119
120                        EigenDecomposition ed = new EigenDecomposition(Z);
121                        
122                        double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
123                        int k = getSmallestPositiveIdx(evals);
124
125//                      IJ.log("l = " + l);
126                        RealVector ek = ed.getEigenvector(k);
127                        
128                        // Version1 ---------------------------------------------------
129//                      qq = Matrix.solve(S.multiply(svd.getVT()), ek);         // solve S * V^T * p = ek
130                        // Version2 ---------------------------------------------------
131                        qq = V.operate(MatrixUtils.inverse(S).operate(ek));     // simpler since S is diagonal
132                        // ------------------------------------------------------------
133                }
134                
135                double[][] M = 
136                        {{ 1, 0, 0, 0 },
137                         {-2*xr, 1, 0, 0 },
138                         {-2*yr, 0, 1, 0 },
139                         {sqr(xr) + sqr(yr), -xr, -yr, 1}};
140                
141                RealMatrix MM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(M);
142                
143                double[] q = MM.operate(qq).toArray();
144                return q;
145        }
146        
147        private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
148                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
149                int minidx = -1;
150                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
151                        // ignore complex eigenvalues (x[i] == NaN)
152                        if (Double.isFinite(x[i]) && x[i] >= 0 && x[i] < minval) {
153                                minval = x[i];
154                                minidx = i;
155                        }
156                }
157                return minidx;
158        }
159
160        @Override
161        public double[] getParameters() {
162                return this.q;
163        }
164                
165}
